bcl:definition.bcl:text: agreement means an agreement, referred to in section 64.6 of the Canada Marine Act, among Canada and the government, or agents of either, in respect of an undertaking situated in a port in British Columbia;
federal regulation means a regulation under section 64.1 of the Canada Marine Act that applies in relation to an undertaking situated in a port in British Columbia;
port has the same meaning as in the Canada Marine Act;
provincial body means a corporation or other entity that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is established or continued under an enactment, and
has powers or duties under an enactment;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: provincial official means a person who

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is a member of the Executive Council, an employee of the government or a person appointed to or employed by a provincial body, and
has powers or duties under an enactment;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: undertaking means an undertaking, or an undertaking in a class, designated for the purposes of section 64.1 (2) (a) of the Canada Marine Act.

bcl:section.bcl:text: With the prior approval of the Lieutenant Governor in Council, a member of the Executive Council may enter into an agreement on behalf of the government.
A provincial official or provincial body has authority to exercise a power or perform a duty under a federal regulation if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the federal regulation incorporates by reference the enactment of British Columbia under which the power is granted or the duty is imposed on the provincial official or provincial body, and
the government has entered into an agreement providing for the administration and enforcement of the federal regulation by the provincial official or provincial body.

bcl:section.bcl:text: This Act comes into force by regulation of the Lieutenant Governor in Council.
